page.description: Optional. You can specify the ids of buttons that will show/hide any of the Panels in this Panel Layout that have been docked (i.e. hidden). To be useful this property requires a docked panel and another panel card with a button inside it.

figure.title: Clicking a button to reveal a hidden panel

section.description: Clicking the [...] button next to the Docked Panel controller buttons property opens a genie that lets you assign a specific button to a specific docked panel.

figure.title: When 'x' button is clicked 'x' panel appears

section.title: How to create a docked panel
section.description: You can defined a 'docked' Panel Card by changing that Panel Card's 'Dock' property in the 'Panel Size and Dock Options' section. For a complete explanation of docking watch this five part video: [part 1], [part 2], [part 3], [part 4], [part 5] or follow the guide below

step.description: In the UX Builder, on the Controls page, check the 'Mobile' option in the page toolbar..
Open the Panels menu. Click the [Panel Layout] option to add a Panel Layout to the control
Highlight the Panel Layout that was added. Click on [Panel Card] option in the Panels menu, then click 'Insert After' to place the Panel Card inside the Panel Layout
step.note: If the Panel Card is not in the Panel Layout use the blue up and down arrows in the toolbar to move it into place.

step.description: Give the Panel Card the name 'Docked Panel Card'. To do this highlight the Panel Card and then click the [...] button next to the Id property in the Panel Card Properties section of the Properties list.
Open the Data Controls menu and click on [List] to add a list control to Panel Card.
Highlight the List control. In the Properties menu click the [...] button next to the List properties property.
On the List Builder's Data Source pane select 'Static' as the Data Source Type, then click the [...] button next to the Static data property.
Define a simple list of Choices like this:
step.example: Choices Choice 1 Choice 2 Choice 3 Choice 4 Choice 5

step.description: Open the List Layout pane. Use the blue > arrow to move the Choices field from the Available Fields list into the 'Columns in List' area. Click OK to Close the List Builder
Highlight the DOCKED_PANEL_CARD. In the Card's Properties list go to the Panel Size and Dock Options section. Set the Layout size property to 200px
Click the dropdown next to the 'Dock' property and select the collapse-before option.
The Docked Panel has been created but is still in its hidden state. The next section will describe how to make the docked panel appear on the click of the button.

section.title: Adding buttons to show/hide docked Panels

step.description: Continuing from the section above, open the Panels menu on the UX Controls page.
Click the [Panel Card] option to add another Panel Card inside the Panel Layout. Give this Panel Card an Id MAIN_PANEL.
Highlight the 'MAIN_PANEL' Panel Card. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on the [Button] option to add a button inside the 'MAIN_PANEL'. Make the button text read 'Docked Panel'
step.note: To change the Button text property first highlight the button control and then write 'Docked Panel' in the 'Button text property. This is located in the Button Properties section of the properties list.

step.description: Now highlight the Panel Layout in the control list.
In the Properties click the [...] button next to the 'Docked Panel controller buttons' property in the 'Panel Layout Properties' section.
Click the 'Add Button Controller' button
For the Button id select the 'Docked Panel' button from the dropdown. For the Panel id select the 'DOCKED_PANEL_CARD'. Click OK and OK again.
Run the Component in Live Preview. You should see the MAIN_PANEL with a 'Docked Layout' button on it
When you click on the 'Docked Layout' button you should see the DOCKED_PANEL_CARD appear with the list control that was defined inside it.
